Theory Phi_BI.Phi_BI

(*TODO: lift it to a chapter*)
chapter â€¹A Bunched Implications Equipped with Satisfactionâ€º

text â€¹It also contains a simplified BI specialized for only necessary constructs required
  by âˆ—â€¹Multi-Term Formâ€º.

â§ âˆ—â€¹Multi-Term Formâ€º is the canonical form in the reasoning of Ï†-System, which demonstrates
  abstractions directly and clearly in a localized way. It is characterized by form,
\[ â€¹âˆƒa. (xâ‡©1 â¦‚ Tâ‡©1 âˆ— xâ‡©2 â¦‚ Tâ‡©2 âˆ— â‹¯ xâ‡©n â¦‚ Tâ‡©n) âˆ§ Pâ€º \]
where â€¹Pâ€º is a pure proposition only containing free variables occurring in â€¹xâ‡©1,â‹¯,xâ‡©n,aâ€º.
It relates the concrete resource to a set of abstract objects â€¹{(xâ‡©1,â‹¯,xâ‡©n) |a. P}â€º if
  âˆ—â€¹variables â€¹aâ€º are not free in â€¹Tâ‡©1,â‹¯,Tâ‡©nâ€ºâ€º.
All specifications in Ï†-System are in Multi-Term Form. It is so pervasive that we use a set-like
notation to denote them,
\[ â€¹(xâ‡©1 â¦‚ Tâ‡©1 âˆ— xâ‡©2 â¦‚ Tâ‡©2 âˆ— â‹¯ xâ‡©n â¦‚ Tâ‡©n ğ—Œğ—ğ–»ğ—ƒ a. P)â€º \]
Readers may read it as a set,
\[ â€¹{ xâ‡©1 â¦‚ Tâ‡©1 âˆ— xâ‡©2 â¦‚ Tâ‡©2 âˆ— â‹¯ xâ‡©n â¦‚ Tâ‡©n |a. P }â€º \]

â§ âˆ—â€¹Simple Multi-Term Formâ€º is a MTF where there is no existential quantification and the attached
  â€¹Pâ€º is trivial â€¹Trueâ€º, viz., it is characterized by
  \[ â€¹xâ‡©1 â¦‚ Tâ‡©1 âˆ— â‹¯ âˆ— xâ‡©n â¦‚ Tâ‡©nâ€º \]
â€º

text â€¹
Specifically, in this minimal specialized BI:

  â–ª It does not have a general additive conjunction (â€¹âˆ§â€º) that connects any BI assertions,
    but only the one (â€¹A ğ—Œğ—ğ–»ğ—ƒ Pâ€º) connects a BI assertion â€¹Aâ€º and a pure assertion â€¹Pâ€º,
    because it is exactly what at most the MTF requires.

  â–ª Implication does not occur in assertions (of Ï†-SL), but it represents transformations of
    abstraction so has a significant role in reasoning (rules).
    We emphasize this transformation by assigning the implication with notation
    â€¹A ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ B ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— P â‰œ A âŸ¶ B âˆ§ Pâ€º, where â€¹Pâ€º is a pure assertion.
    The â€¹Pâ€º helps to capture the information (in abstract domain) lost in the
    weakening of this implication.
    Currying implications like â€¹A âŸ¶ B âŸ¶ Câ€º are never used in Ï†-BI.

  â–ª Optionally we have universal quantification. It can be used to quantify free variables
    if for any reason free variables are inadmissible. The universal quantifier is typically
    not necessary in Ï†-BI and Ï†-SL, where we use free variables directly. However, in some
    situation, like when we consider transitions of resource states and we want a transition
    relation for each procedure, we need a single universally quantified assertion,
    instead of a family of assertions indexed by free variables.

  â–ª The use of a implication represents a transformation of abstraction.
    Therefore, implications are never curried or nested, always in form â€¹X âŸ¶ Y âˆ§ Pâ€º
    where â€¹X, Yâ€º are MTF and â€¹Pâ€º is a pure proposition.
    We denote them by notation â€¹X ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ Y ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— Pâ€º.

  â–ª It only has multiplicative conjunctions, specialized additive conjunction described above,
    existential quantification, and optionally universal quantification,
    which are all the MTF requires,
    plus implications that only occur in reasoning rules.
    Any other things, should be some specific Ï†-Types expressing their meaning
    specifically and particularly.
â€º

theory Phi_BI
  imports "Phi_Logic_Programming_Reasoner.PLPR" Phi_Preliminary
  abbrevs "<:>" = "â¦‚"
      and "<trans>" = "ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ"
      and "<transforms>" = "ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ"
      and "<with>"  = "ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ—"
      and "<subj>" = "ğ—Œğ—ğ–»ğ—ƒ"
      and "<when>" = "ğ—ğ—ğ–¾ğ—‡"
      and "<remains>" = "ğ—‹ğ–¾ğ—†ğ–ºğ—‚ğ—‡ğ—Œ"
      and "<get>" = "ğ—€ğ–¾ğ—"
      and "<map>" = "ğ—†ğ–ºğ—‰"
      and "<by>" = "ğ–»ğ—’"
      and "<from>" = "ğ–¿ğ—‹ğ—ˆğ—†"
      and "<remaining>" = "ğ—‹ğ–¾ğ—†ğ–ºğ—‚ğ—‡ğ—‚ğ—‡ğ—€"
      and "<demanding>" = "ğ–½ğ–¾ğ—†ğ–ºğ—‡ğ–½ğ—‚ğ—‡ğ—€"
      and "<to>" = "ğ—ğ—ˆ"
      and "<over>" = "ğ—ˆğ—ğ–¾ğ—‹"
      and "<subst>" = "ğ—Œğ—ğ–»ğ—Œğ—"
      and "<for>" = "ğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹"
      and "<TP>" = "ğ’¯ğ’«"
begin

section â€¹Judgementâ€º

datatype 'a BI = BI (dest: â€¹'a setâ€º)
hide_const (open) dest

definition Satisfaction :: â€¹'a â‡’ 'a BI â‡’ boolâ€º (infix "âŠ¨" 50)
  where â€¹(x âŠ¨ A) âŸ· (x âˆˆ BI.dest A)â€º

lemma Satisfaction_BI_red[simp]:
  â€¹ x âŠ¨ BI S âŸ· x âˆˆ S â€º
  unfolding Satisfaction_def by simp

lemma In_BI_dest[iff]:
  â€¹ x âˆˆ BI.dest S âŸ· x âŠ¨ S â€º
  by (cases S; simp)

subsubsection â€¹Bootstrap Basicsâ€º

lemma split_BI_all: â€¹(âˆ€x. P x) âŸ· (âˆ€x. P (BI x))â€º by (metis BI.collapse) 
lemma split_BI_ex: â€¹(âˆƒx. P x) âŸ· (âˆƒx. P (BI x))â€º by (metis BI.collapse) 

lemma split_BI_meta_all:
  â€¹(â‹€x. PROP P x) â‰¡ (â‹€x. PROP P (BI x)) â€º
proof
  fix x assume â€¹â‹€x. PROP P xâ€º then show â€¹PROP P (BI x)â€º .
next
  fix x assume â€¹â‹€x. PROP P (BI x)â€º from this[of â€¹BI.dest xâ€º] show â€¹PROP P xâ€º by simp
qed

subsection â€¹Algebraic Properties of BIâ€º

instantiation BI :: (type) zero begin
definition zero_BI where "zero_BI = BI {}"
instance ..
end

instantiation BI :: (one) one begin
definition "one_BI = BI {1::'a}"
instance ..
end

instantiation BI :: ("{sep_disj,times}") times begin
definition "times_BI P Q = BI { x * y | x y. x âŠ¨ P âˆ§ y âŠ¨ Q âˆ§ x ## y }"
instance ..
end

instance BI :: ("{sep_disj,times}") mult_zero 
  by (standard; simp add: zero_BI_def times_BI_def)

instance BI :: ("{sep_magma_1,no_inverse}") no_inverse
  by (standard; simp add: one_BI_def times_BI_def set_eq_iff split_BI_meta_all;
      metis (no_types, opaque_lifting) no_inverse sep_magma_1_left sep_magma_1_right)

instantiation BI :: (type) total_sep_disj begin
definition sep_disj_BI :: â€¹'a BI â‡’ 'a BI â‡’ boolâ€º where [simp]: â€¹sep_disj_BI _ _ = Trueâ€º
instance by (standard; simp)
end

instance BI :: (sep_magma) sep_magma ..

instance BI :: (sep_magma_1) sep_magma_1 proof
  fix x :: â€¹'a BIâ€º
  show â€¹1 * x = xâ€º by (cases x; simp add: one_BI_def times_BI_def)
  show â€¹x * 1 = xâ€º by (cases x; simp add: one_BI_def times_BI_def)
  show â€¹x ## 1â€º by simp
  show â€¹1 ## xâ€º by simp
qed

instance BI :: (sep_no_inverse) sep_no_inverse
  by (standard, simp add: one_BI_def times_BI_def set_eq_iff split_BI_meta_all;
      metis (no_types, opaque_lifting) sep_magma_1_left sep_magma_1_right sep_no_inverse)

instance BI :: (sep_disj_distrib) sep_disj_distrib by (standard; simp)

instance BI :: (sep_semigroup) semigroup_mult
  apply (standard; clarsimp simp add: times_BI_def algebra_simps set_eq_iff; rule; clarsimp)
  using sep_disj_multD2 sep_disj_multI2 sep_mult_assoc apply blast
  by (metis sep_disj_multD1 sep_disj_multI1 sep_mult_assoc)

instance BI :: (sep_monoid) monoid_mult
  by standard simp_all

instance BI :: (sep_ab_semigroup) ab_semigroup_mult
  apply (standard; simp add: times_BI_def set_eq_iff)
  using sep_disj_commute sep_mult_commute by blast

instance BI :: (sep_algebra) comm_monoid_mult
  by (standard; simp_all add: one_set_def times_set_def)

instantiation BI :: (type) comm_monoid_add begin
definition â€¹plus_BI x y = BI (BI.dest x âˆª BI.dest y)â€º
instance by standard (auto simp add: plus_BI_def zero_BI_def split_BI_meta_all)
end

instantiation BI :: (type) order begin
definition less_BI :: â€¹'a BI â‡’ 'a BI â‡’ boolâ€º
  where â€¹less_BI A B âŸ· BI.dest A < BI.dest Bâ€º
definition less_eq_BI :: â€¹'a BI â‡’ 'a BI â‡’ boolâ€º
  where â€¹less_eq_BI A B âŸ· BI.dest A â‰¤ BI.dest Bâ€º

lemma less_BI[simp]: â€¹ BI A < BI B âŸ· A < B â€º unfolding less_BI_def by simp
lemma less_eq_BI[simp]: â€¹ BI A â‰¤ BI B âŸ· A â‰¤ B â€º unfolding less_eq_BI_def by simp

lemma less_eq_BI_iff: â€¹ A â‰¤ B âŸ· (âˆ€w. w âŠ¨ A âŸ¶ w âŠ¨ B) â€º
  by (cases A; cases B; auto)

instance by (standard; simp add: split_BI_meta_all; blast)
end

instance BI :: (type) ordered_comm_monoid_add
  by standard (auto simp add: plus_BI_def zero_BI_def split_BI_meta_all)

lemma plus_BI_S_S [simp]: â€¹S + S = Sâ€º for S :: â€¹'a BIâ€º by (simp add: plus_BI_def)

instance BI :: (sep_semigroup) ordered_semiring_0
  by standard (auto simp add: zero_BI_def plus_BI_def times_BI_def split_BI_meta_all)

instance BI :: (sep_monoid) semiring_1
  by standard (auto simp add: zero_BI_def one_BI_def plus_BI_def times_BI_def split_BI_meta_all)

instance BI :: (sep_ab_semigroup) ordered_comm_semiring
  by standard (auto simp add: zero_BI_def plus_BI_def times_BI_def split_BI_meta_all set_eq_iff)

instance BI :: (sep_algebra) comm_semiring_1
  by standard auto

instantiation BI :: (type) order_top begin
definition top_BI :: â€¹'a BIâ€º where â€¹top_BI = BI topâ€º
instance by (standard; simp add: top_BI_def split_BI_meta_all)
end

instantiation BI :: (type) order_bot begin
definition bot_BI :: â€¹'a BIâ€º where â€¹bot_BI = BI botâ€º
instance by (standard; simp add: bot_BI_def split_BI_meta_all)
end

notation inf (infixl "âŠ“" 70)
     and sup (infixl "âŠ”" 65)

instantiation BI :: (type) semilattice_inf begin
definition inf_BI :: â€¹'a BI â‡’ 'a BI â‡’ 'a BIâ€º
  where â€¹inf_BI A B = BI (BI.dest A âˆ© BI.dest B)â€º

lemma inf_BI_red[simp]: â€¹BI A âŠ“ BI B = BI (A âŠ“ B)â€º by (simp add: inf_BI_def)

instance by (standard; simp add: split_BI_meta_all)
end

instantiation BI :: (type) semilattice_sup begin
definition sup_BI :: â€¹'a BI â‡’ 'a BI â‡’ 'a BIâ€º
  where â€¹sup_BI A B = BI (BI.dest A âˆª BI.dest B)â€º

lemma sup_BI_red[simp]: â€¹BI A âŠ” BI B = BI (A âŠ” B)â€º by (simp add: sup_BI_def)

instance by (standard; simp add: split_BI_meta_all)
end

instance BI :: (type) lattice by standard

instantiation BI :: (type) complete_lattice begin

definition Inf_BI :: â€¹'a BI set â‡’ 'a BIâ€º
  where â€¹Inf_BI S = BI (Inf (BI.dest ` S))â€º
definition Sup_BI :: â€¹'a BI set â‡’ 'a BIâ€º
  where â€¹Sup_BI S = BI (Sup (BI.dest ` S))â€º

lemma Inf_BI_expn[iff]:
  â€¹ w âŠ¨ Inf S âŸ· (âˆ€AâˆˆS. w âŠ¨ A) â€º
  unfolding Inf_BI_def by (auto simp: split_BI_meta_all)

lemma Sup_BI_expn[iff]:
  â€¹ w âŠ¨ Sup S âŸ· (âˆƒAâˆˆS. w âŠ¨ A) â€º
  unfolding Sup_BI_def
  by (auto simp: split_BI_meta_all)

instance by (
      (standard; (simp add: split_BI_meta_all less_eq_BI_iff)?),
      meson Satisfaction_BI_red,
      metis BI.collapse Satisfaction_def,
      simp add: Inf_BI_def top_BI_def,
      simp add: Sup_BI_def bot_BI_def)
end

subsection â€¹Basicsâ€º

subsubsection â€¹Basic Operations & Rulesâ€º

lemma BI_eq_iff:
  â€¹S = S' âŸ· (âˆ€u. u âŠ¨ S âŸ· u âŠ¨ S')â€º
  unfolding Satisfaction_def
  by (cases S, cases S', simp add: set_eq_iff)

definition I_image :: â€¹('a â‡’ 'b) â‡’ 'a BI â‡’ 'b BIâ€º  (infixr "`â‡©I" 90)
  where â€¹ f `â‡©I A = BI (f ` BI.dest A) â€º

lemma I_image_red[simp]:
  â€¹ f `â‡©I BI A = BI (f ` A) â€º
  unfolding I_image_def
  by simp

lemma I_image_expn[iff, Ï†expns]:
  â€¹ w âŠ¨ f `â‡©I A âŸ· (âˆƒw'. w = f w' âˆ§ w' âŠ¨ A) â€º
  by (cases A; simp; blast)

subsubsection â€¹Basic Rewritesâ€º

lemma sep_conj_expn[simp, Ï†expns]:
  â€¹uv âŠ¨ (S * T) âŸ· (âˆƒu v. uv = u * v âˆ§ u âŠ¨ S âˆ§ v âŠ¨ T âˆ§ u ## v)â€º
  unfolding Satisfaction_def times_BI_def
  by simp

definition Subjection :: " 'p BI â‡’ bool â‡’ 'p BI " (infixl "ğ—Œğ—ğ–»ğ—ƒ" 15)
  where " (T ğ—Œğ—ğ–»ğ—ƒ P) = BI {p. p âŠ¨ T âˆ§ P}"

lemma Subjection_expn[iff, Ï†expns]:
  â€¹p âŠ¨ (S ğ—Œğ—ğ–»ğ—ƒ P) âŸ· p âŠ¨ S âˆ§ Pâ€º
  by (cases S; simp add: Subjection_def)

(*
lemma Subjection_Id_on:
  â€¹Id_on (S ğ—Œğ—ğ–»ğ—ƒ P) = (Id_on S ğ—Œğ—ğ–»ğ—ƒ P)â€º
  by (auto simp add: Subjection_expn_set)
*)

lemma Subjection_image:
  â€¹f `â‡©I (S ğ—Œğ—ğ–»ğ—ƒ P) = (f `â‡©I S ğ—Œğ—ğ–»ğ—ƒ P)â€º
  unfolding BI_eq_iff
  by simp blast

definition ExBI :: " ('x â‡’ 'c BI) â‡’ 'c BI" (binder "âˆƒ*" 14)
  where "ExBI S = BI {p. (âˆƒc. p âŠ¨ S c)}"

lemma ExBI_expn[iff, Ï†expns]:
  â€¹p âŠ¨ (ExBI S) âŸ· (âˆƒx. p âŠ¨ S x)â€º
  by (simp add: ExBI_def)

lemma Zero_expn[iff, Ï†expns]:
  â€¹Â¬ (p âŠ¨ 0)â€º
  unfolding Satisfaction_def
  by (simp add: zero_BI_def)

lemma One_expn[iff, Ï†expns]:
  â€¹v âŠ¨ 1 âŸ· v = 1â€º
  unfolding Satisfaction_def
  by (simp add: one_BI_def)

lemma Top_expn[iff, Ï†expns]:
  â€¹v âŠ¨ topâ€º
  unfolding Satisfaction_def
  by (simp add: top_BI_def)

subsubsection â€¹Liftâ€º

definition BI_lift :: â€¹'a set â‡’ 'a BIâ€º
  where â€¹BI_lift S = BI Sâ€º

lemma BI_lift_expn[iff]:
  â€¹ w âŠ¨ BI_lift S âŸ· w âˆˆ S â€º
  unfolding BI_lift_def by simp


subsection â€¹Reasoning Configurationâ€º

Ï†reasoner_group extract_pure_sat = (%extract_pure+100, [%extract_pure+100, %extract_pure+130])
                                    for (â€¹ğ—‹EIF _ _â€º, â€¹ğ—‹ESC _ _â€º)
                                     in extract_pure_all and > extract_pure
  â€¹Rules extracting BI properties down to Satisfactionâ€º

section â€¹Connectivesâ€º

subsection â€¹Ï†-Typeâ€º

type_synonym ('concrete,'abstract) Ï† = " 'abstract â‡’ 'concrete BI "

definition Ï†Type :: "'b â‡’ ('a,'b) Ï† â‡’ 'a BI" (infix "â¦‚" 20) where " x â¦‚ T â‰¡ T x"

text â€¹Convention of name:

In â€¹x â¦‚ Tâ€º, we refer to â€¹xâ€º as the âˆ—â€¹objectâ€º or the âˆ—â€¹Ï†-type termâ€º and â€¹Tâ€º as the âˆ—â€¹Ï†-typeâ€º.
For convenience, when the context is unambiguous, we also call the entire â€¹x â¦‚ Tâ€º as 'Ï†-type',
but as âˆ—â€¹Ï†-type assertionâ€º to be precise.
â€º

subsubsection â€¹Basic \& Auxiliary Rulesâ€º

lemma Ï†Type_eqI:
  â€¹(âˆ€x p. p âŠ¨ (x â¦‚ a) âŸ· p âŠ¨ (x â¦‚ b)) âŸ¹ a = bâ€º
  unfolding Ï†Type_def Satisfaction_def
  by (metis ext less_BI_def less_eq_BI_def order.order_iff_strict subset_iff subset_not_subset_eq)

lemma Ï†Type_protect_type_cong:
  â€¹ x â‰¡ x'
âŸ¹ x â¦‚ T â‰¡ x' â¦‚ Tâ€º
  by simp

setup â€¹Context.theory_map (PLPR_Rule_Gen.Rule_Gen_SS.map (
  Simplifier.add_cong @{thm' Ï†Type_protect_type_cong}))â€º

ML_file â€¹library/tools/simp_congruence.MLâ€º

subsection â€¹Inhabitanceâ€º

definition Satisfiable :: " 'a BI â‡’ bool "
  where "Satisfiable S = (âˆƒp. p âŠ¨ S)"
  â€• â€¹â€¹Satisfiable Sâ€º should be always regarded as an atom in the view of ATPs.

      The fallback of extracting implied pure facts returns the original â€¹Satisfiable Tâ€º unchanged,
      â€¹P ğ—‚ğ—†ğ—‰ğ—…ğ—‚ğ–¾ğ—Œ Satisfiable Pâ€º where â€¹Satisfiable Pâ€º should be regarded as an atom.â€º

definition Inhabited
  where â€¹Inhabited T âŸ· (âˆƒx. Satisfiable (x â¦‚ T))â€º


abbreviation Inhabitance_Implication :: â€¹'a BI â‡’ bool â‡’ boolâ€º (infix "ğ—‚ğ—†ğ—‰ğ—…ğ—‚ğ–¾ğ—Œ" 10)
  where â€¹S ğ—‚ğ—†ğ—‰ğ—…ğ—‚ğ–¾ğ—Œ P â‰¡ ğ—‹EIF (Satisfiable S) P â€º
  â€• â€¹P is weaker than S. We want to get a simpler P and as strong as possible. â€º

abbreviation Sufficient_Inhabitance :: â€¹bool â‡’ 'a BI â‡’ boolâ€º (infix "ğ—Œğ—ğ–¿ğ–¿ğ—‚ğ–¼ğ–¾ğ—Œ" 10)
  where â€¹P ğ—Œğ—ğ–¿ğ–¿ğ—‚ğ–¼ğ–¾ğ—Œ S â‰¡ ğ—‹ESC P (Satisfiable S) â€º
  â€• â€¹P is stronger than S. We want to get a simpler P and as weak as possible. â€º

declare [[
  Ï†reason_default_pattern â€¹Satisfiable ?X âŸ¶ _â€º â‡’ â€¹ERROR TEXT(â€¹bad formâ€º)â€º (100)
                      and â€¹_ âŸ¶ Satisfiable ?Xâ€º â‡’ â€¹ERROR TEXT(â€¹bad formâ€º)â€º (100)
                      and â€¹Inhabited ?Tâ€º  â‡’ â€¹Inhabited ?Tâ€º      (100),
  Ï†premise_attribute once? [Ï†reason? %local] for â€¹Inhabited _â€º  (%Ï†attr)
]]

Ï†reasoner_group extract_pure_phity = (10, [10,10]) for (â€¹x â¦‚ T ğ—‚ğ—†ğ—‰ğ—…ğ—‚ğ–¾ğ—Œ Pâ€º, â€¹P ğ—Œğ—ğ–¿ğ–¿ğ—‚ğ–¼ğ–¾ğ—Œ x â¦‚ Tâ€º)
  > extract_pure_fallback and < extract_pure
  â€¹Entry points towards â€¹Abstract_Domainâ€º and â€¹Abstract_Domainâ‡©Lâ€º â€º

Ï†reasoner_group inhabited_all = (100, [10, 3000]) for (â€¹Inhabited Tâ€º) â€¹â€º
  and inhabited = (1000, [1000, 1030]) in inhabited_all â€¹â€º
  and inhabited_derived = (40, [30,50]) in inhabited_all and < inhabited â€¹â€º
  and inhabited_default = (10, [10,20]) in inhabited_all and < inhabited_derived â€¹â€º

subsubsection â€¹Basic Rulesâ€º

lemma Satisfiable_I:
  â€¹x âŠ¨ S âŸ¹ Satisfiable Sâ€º
  unfolding Satisfiable_def ..

lemma Satisfiable_fallback:
  â€¹ X ğ—‚ğ—†ğ—‰ğ—…ğ—‚ğ–¾ğ—Œ Satisfiable X â€º
  unfolding ğ—‹EIF_def by blast

lemma Suf_Satisfiable_fallback:
  â€¹ Satisfiable X ğ—Œğ—ğ–¿ğ–¿ğ—‚ğ–¼ğ–¾ğ—Œ X â€º
  unfolding ğ—‹ESC_def by blast

Ï†reasoner_ML Satisfiable_fallback default 2 (â€¹_ ğ—‚ğ—†ğ—‰ğ—…ğ—‚ğ–¾ğ—Œ _â€º) =
â€¹fn (_, (ctxt,sequent)) => Seq.make (fn () =>
  if Config.get ctxt Phi_Reasoners.is_generating_extraction_rule
  then SOME ((ctxt, Thm.permute_prems 0 ~1 sequent), Seq.empty)
  else SOME ((ctxt, @{thm Satisfiable_fallback} RS sequent), Seq.empty)
)â€º

Ï†reasoner_ML Suf_Satisfiable_fallback default 2 (â€¹_ ğ—Œğ—ğ–¿ğ–¿ğ—‚ğ–¼ğ–¾ğ—Œ _â€º) =
â€¹fn (_, (ctxt,sequent)) => Seq.make (fn () =>
  if Config.get ctxt Phi_Reasoners.is_generating_extraction_rule
  then SOME ((ctxt, Thm.permute_prems 0 ~1 sequent), Seq.empty)
  else SOME ((ctxt, @{thm Suf_Satisfiable_fallback} RS sequent), Seq.empty)
)â€º

lemma [Ï†reason 1000]:
  â€¹ P ğ—Œğ—ğ–¿ğ–¿ğ—‚ğ–¼ğ–¾ğ—Œ A
âŸ¹ ğ—‰ğ—‹ğ–¾ğ—†ğ—‚ğ—Œğ–¾ P
âŸ¹ Satisfiable Aâ€º
  unfolding ğ—‹ESC_def Premise_def
  by blast

lemma inhabited_type_EIF':
  â€¹ ğ—‹EIF (Inhabited T) (âˆƒx. Satisfiable (x â¦‚ T)) â€º
  unfolding Inhabited_def ğ—‹EIF_def
  by blast

bundle deriving_intabited_type = inhabited_type_EIF'[Ï†reason default %extract_pure]



paragraph â€¹Sum Typeâ€º

lemma [Ï†reason 1020]:
  â€¹ A a ğ—‚ğ—†ğ—‰ğ—…ğ—‚ğ–¾ğ—Œ P
âŸ¹ case_sum A B (Inl a) ğ—‚ğ—†ğ—‰ğ—…ğ—‚ğ–¾ğ—Œ Pâ€º
  by simp

lemma [Ï†reason 1020]:
  â€¹ B b ğ—‚ğ—†ğ—‰ğ—…ğ—‚ğ–¾ğ—Œ P
âŸ¹ case_sum A B (Inr b) ğ—‚ğ—†ğ—‰ğ—…ğ—‚ğ–¾ğ—Œ Pâ€º
  by simp

lemma [Ï†reason 1000]:
  â€¹ (â‹€a. ğ–¼ğ—ˆğ—‡ğ–½ğ—‚ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ˆğ—‡ x = Inl a âŸ¹ A a ğ—‚ğ—†ğ—‰ğ—…ğ—‚ğ–¾ğ—Œ P a)
âŸ¹ (â‹€b. ğ–¼ğ—ˆğ—‡ğ–½ğ—‚ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ˆğ—‡ x = Inr b âŸ¹ B b ğ—‚ğ—†ğ—‰ğ—…ğ—‚ğ–¾ğ—Œ Q b)
âŸ¹ case_sum A B x ğ—‚ğ—†ğ—‰ğ—…ğ—‚ğ–¾ğ—Œ case_sum P Q x â€º
  by (cases x; simp)



subsection â€¹Abstract Domainâ€º

lemma typing_inhabited: "p âŠ¨ (x â¦‚ T) âŸ¹ Satisfiable (x â¦‚ T)"
  unfolding Satisfiable_def Ï†Type_def by blast

definition Abstract_Domain :: â€¹('c,'a) Ï† â‡’ ('a â‡’ bool) â‡’ boolâ€º
  where â€¹Abstract_Domain T d âŸ· (âˆ€x. x â¦‚ T ğ—‚ğ—†ğ—‰ğ—…ğ—‚ğ–¾ğ—Œ d x)â€º
  â€• â€¹Upper Boundâ€º

definition Abstract_Domainâ‡©L :: â€¹('c,'a) Ï† â‡’ ('a â‡’ bool) â‡’ boolâ€º
  where â€¹Abstract_Domainâ‡©L T d âŸ· (âˆ€x. d x ğ—Œğ—ğ–¿ğ–¿ğ—‚ğ–¼ğ–¾ğ—Œ x â¦‚ T)â€º
  â€• â€¹Lower Boundâ€º

declare [[
  Ï†reason_default_pattern â€¹Abstract_Domain ?T _â€º â‡’ â€¹Abstract_Domain ?T _â€º (100)
                      and â€¹Abstract_Domainâ‡©L ?T _â€º â‡’ â€¹Abstract_Domainâ‡©L ?T _â€º (100),
  Ï†premise_attribute once? [Ï†reason? %local] for â€¹Abstract_Domain  _ _â€º  (%Ï†attr) ,
  Ï†premise_attribute once? [Ï†reason? %local] for â€¹Abstract_Domainâ‡©L _ _â€º  (%Ï†attr)
]]

Ï†reasoner_group abstract_domain_all = (1000, [1, 2000]) for (â€¹Abstract_Domain T dâ€º, â€¹Abstract_Domainâ‡©L T dâ€º)
    â€¹All reasoning rules giving â€¹Abstract_Domainâ€º or â€¹Abstract_Domainâ‡©Lâ€ºâ€º
  and abstract_domain = (1000, [1000, 1000]) for (â€¹Abstract_Domain T dâ€º, â€¹Abstract_Domainâ‡©L T dâ€º)
                                             in abstract_domain_all
    â€¹Normal reasoning rules for â€¹Abstract_Domainâ€º, â€¹Abstract_Domainâ‡©Lâ€ºâ€º
  and abstract_domain_fallback = (1, [1,1]) for (â€¹Abstract_Domain T dâ€º, â€¹Abstract_Domainâ‡©L T dâ€º) < abstract_domain
                                            in abstract_domain_all
    â€¹Fallbacks reasoning rules for â€¹Abstract_Domainâ€º, â€¹Abstract_Domainâ‡©Lâ€º â€º
  and derived_abstract_domain = (60, [50,70]) for (â€¹Abstract_Domain T dâ€º, â€¹Abstract_Domainâ‡©L T dâ€º)
                                              in abstract_domain_all and < abstract_domain
    â€¹Automatically derived rulesâ€º

  and extract_ğ—‚ğ—†ğ—‰ğ—…ğ—‚ğ–¾ğ—Œ = (%extract_pure+40, [%extract_pure+40, %extract_pure+70])
                       for (â€¹ğ—‹EIF (A ğ—‚ğ—†ğ—‰ğ—…ğ—‚ğ–¾ğ—Œ P) Qâ€º, â€¹ğ—‹ESC Q (A ğ—‚ğ—†ğ—‰ğ—…ğ—‚ğ–¾ğ—Œ P)â€º,
                            â€¹ğ—‹EIF (A ğ—Œğ—ğ–¿ğ–¿ğ—‚ğ–¼ğ–¾ğ—Œ P) Qâ€º, â€¹ğ—‹ESC Q (A ğ—Œğ—ğ–¿ğ–¿ğ—‚ğ–¼ğ–¾ğ—Œ P)â€º)
                       and > extract_pure and < extract_pure_sat â€¹â€º


subsubsection â€¹Extracting Pure Factsâ€º

âŸ¹ ğ—‹EIF (A ğ—‚ğ—†ğ—‰ğ—…ğ—‚ğ–¾ğ—Œ P) (A' âŸ¶ P) â€º
  unfolding ğ—‹EIF_def ğ—‹ESC_def
  by blast

  â€¹ ğ—‹EIF (A ğ—‚ğ—†ğ—‰ğ—…ğ—‚ğ–¾ğ—Œ P) ((âˆƒv. v âŠ¨ A) âŸ¶ P) â€º
  unfolding ğ—‹EIF_def Satisfiable_def
  by blast

âŸ¹ ğ—‹ESC (A' âŸ¶ P) (A ğ—‚ğ—†ğ—‰ğ—…ğ—‚ğ–¾ğ—Œ P) â€º

  by blast

  by blast

  â€¹ ğ—‹EIF (Satisfiable A) A'
âŸ¹ ğ—‹EIF (P ğ—Œğ—ğ–¿ğ–¿ğ—‚ğ–¼ğ–¾ğ—Œ A) (P âŸ¶ A') â€º
  unfolding ğ—‹EIF_def ğ—‹ESC_def
  by blast

  unfolding ğ—‹ESC_def Satisfiable_def
  by blast

bundle extracting_Inhabitance_Implication_sat =
          Inhabitance_Implication_ğ’œEIF_Sat [Ï†reason %extract_pure_sat]
          Inhabitance_Implication_ğ’œESC_Sat [Ï†reason %extract_pure_sat]

          Sufficient_Inhabitance_ğ’œEIF_Sat [Ï†reason %extract_pure_sat]
          Sufficient_Inhabitance_ğ’œESC_Sat [Ï†reason %extract_pure_sat]
bundle extracting_Inhabitance_sat begin
  unbundle extracting_Inhabitance_Implication_sat extracting_Sufficient_Inhabitance_sat
end

lemma [Ï†reason %extract_pure_all]:
  â€¹ (â‹€x. ğ—‹EIF ((x â¦‚ T) ğ—‚ğ—†ğ—‰ğ—…ğ—‚ğ–¾ğ—Œ D x) (P x))
âŸ¹ ğ—‹EIF (Abstract_Domain T D) (All P) â€º

âŸ¹ ğ—‹ESC (All P) (Abstract_Domain T D) â€º
  unfolding Abstract_Domain_def ğ—‹ESC_def
  by blast

âŸ¹ ğ—‹EIF (Abstract_Domainâ‡©L T D) (All P) â€º

  by blast

âŸ¹ ğ—‹ESC (All P) (Abstract_Domainâ‡©L T D) â€º
  unfolding Abstract_Domainâ‡©L_def ğ—‹ESC_def
  by blast

  â€¹ (âˆ€x. D x âŸ¶ D' x)
âŸ¹ Abstract_Domain T D
âŸ¹ Abstract_Domain T D' â€º
  unfolding Abstract_Domain_def ğ—‹EIF_def
  by auto

lemma Abstract_Domainâ‡©L_sub:
  â€¹ (âˆ€x. D' x âŸ¶ D x)
âŸ¹ Abstract_Domainâ‡©L T D
âŸ¹ Abstract_Domainâ‡©L T D' â€º
  unfolding Abstract_Domainâ‡©L_def ğ—‹ESC_def
  by auto

  â€¹ Abstract_Domain T D
âŸ¹ x â¦‚ T ğ—‚ğ—†ğ—‰ğ—…ğ—‚ğ–¾ğ—Œ D xâ€º

  by blast

âŸ¹ Inhabited T â€º

subsubsection â€¹Configurationâ€º

declare [[
  Ï†reason_default_pattern_ML â€¹?x â¦‚ ?T ğ—‚ğ—†ğ—‰ğ—…ğ—‚ğ–¾ğ—Œ _â€º â‡’ â€¹
    fn ctxt => fn tm as (_ (*Trueprop*) $ (_ (*ğ—‹EIF*) $ (
                            _ (*Satisfiable*) $ (_ (*Ï†Type*) $ x $ _)) $ _)) =>
      if is_Var x orelse not (Context_Position.is_visible_generic ctxt)
      then NONE
      else error (let open Pretty in string_of (chunks [
            para "Malformed Implication Rule: in â€¹x â¦‚ T ğ—‚ğ—†ğ—‰ğ—…ğ—‚ğ–¾ğ—Œ _â€º the x must be a schematic variable. But given",
            Context.cases Syntax.pretty_term_global Syntax.pretty_term ctxt tm
          ]) end)â€º (1000),

  Ï†reason_default_pattern_ML â€¹_ ğ—Œğ—ğ–¿ğ–¿ğ—‚ğ–¼ğ–¾ğ—Œ _ â¦‚ _â€º â‡’ â€¹
    fn ctxt => fn tm as (_ (*Trueprop*) $ (_ (*ğ—‹ESC*) $ _ $ (
                            _ (*Satisfiable*) $ (_ (*Ï†Type*) $ x $ _)))) =>
      if is_Var x orelse not (Context_Position.is_visible_generic ctxt)
      then NONE
      else error (let open Pretty in string_of (chunks [
            para "Malformed Sufficiency Rule: in â€¹_ ğ—Œğ—ğ–¿ğ–¿ğ—‚ğ–¼ğ–¾ğ—Œ x â¦‚ Tâ€º the x must be a schematic variable. But given",
            Context.cases Syntax.pretty_term_global Syntax.pretty_term ctxt tm
          ]) end)â€º (1000)
]]

setup â€¹ PLPR_Template_Properties.add_property_kinds [
  \<^pattern_prop>â€¹Abstract_Domain _ _â€º, \<^pattern_prop>â€¹Abstract_Domainâ‡©L _ _â€º
]â€º

subsubsection â€¹Template Instantiationâ€º

lemma Satisfiable_rewr_template[Ï†reason_template name T.inh_rewr [simp]]:
  â€¹ Abstract_Domain T D
âŸ¹ Abstract_Domainâ‡©L T D'
âŸ¹ ğ–¼ğ—ˆğ—‡ğ–½ğ—‚ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ˆğ—‡ (âˆ€x. D' x = D x) @tag ğ’œ_template_reason None
âŸ¹ Satisfiable (x â¦‚ T) â‰¡ D x â€º
  unfolding ğ—‹EIF_def ğ—‹ESC_def Action_Tag_def Abstract_Domain_def Abstract_Domainâ‡©L_def Premise_def
  by (clarsimp, smt (verit, best))


subsection â€¹Auxiliary Tagâ€º

definition Ï†Tag :: â€¹mode â‡’ ('c,'x) Ï† â‡’ ('c,'x) Ï†â€º
  where â€¹Ï†Tag mode T â‰¡ Tâ€º

definition Ï†TagA :: â€¹mode â‡’ 'c BI â‡’ 'c BIâ€º
  where â€¹Ï†TagA mode T â‰¡ Tâ€º


subsection â€¹Transformation of Abstractionâ€º

text â€¹The only meaningful implication â€¹âŸ¶â€º under the interpretation of Ï† data refinementâ€º

definition Transformation :: " 'a BI â‡’ 'a BI â‡’ bool â‡’ bool " ("(2_)/ ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ (2_)/ ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— (2_)" [13,13,13] 12)
  where "(A ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ B ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— P) âŸ· (âˆ€v. v âŠ¨ A âŸ¶ v âŠ¨ B âˆ§ P)"
  â€• â€¹Implementation notes: It is safe to unfold Transformation but unsafe to unfold Satisfaction.
      Transformation is always based on Satisfaction but in future when we upgrade our logic onto
      impredicativeness, the definition of Satisfaction will be changed.
      Satisfaction is the bottom abstraction layer.â€º

abbreviation SimpleTransformation :: " 'a BI â‡’ 'a BI â‡’ bool " ("(2_)/ ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ (2_)" [13,13] 12)
  where â€¹SimpleTransformation T U â‰¡ Transformation T U Trueâ€º

text â€¹
Transformation â€¹x â¦‚ T ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ y â¦‚ U ğ—Œğ—ğ–»ğ—ƒ y. f x yâ€º and its dual â€¹y â¦‚ U ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ x â¦‚ T ğ—Œğ—ğ–»ğ—ƒ x. g x yâ€º
constitute a classical Galios connection â€¹(f,g)â€º. However, our method does not apply the Galios
connection directly as our method is synthetic (we do not analysis the relation between
concrete sets and abstract sets once after defining a Ï†-type,
but do deductions by means of transformation rules).
Comparing to analytic methods (the classical methods for data refinement), synthetic methods based
on a higher abstraction simplify representations and give more chances for automation (by means of an inference system),
and in addition, can be combined in program logics more natively.
â€º

text â€¹The name of transformation is good in sense of corresponding to categorical natural transformation.
  If we consider the state transition of a program as a category â€¹ğ’â€º, two Ï†-types â€¹Tâ€º and â€¹Uâ€º form
  functors over â€¹ğ’â€º, and the transformation between â€¹Tâ€º and â€¹Uâ€º is the natural transformation between
  the two functors. â€º

text â€¹TODO: move me
Our method simplifies program verification by lifting it onto an abstract domain.
However, it is hard to universally define what are abstract and what are not.
In a transformation â€¹x â¦‚ T âŸ¶ f(x) â¦‚ Uâ€º, the abstract map â€¹fâ€º can have various expressions and
may fall back to concrete level such as â€¹f(x) = @y(x â¦‚ T âŸ¶ y â¦‚ U)â€º (â€¹@â€º is Hilbert choice operator)
which is always a trivial solution of â€¹fâ€º.


The criterion about what expression of â€¹fâ€º is considered abstract can be given by user.
The abstract maps (â€¹fâ€º) occurring in their annotations or given properties are assumed abstract.
In addition, if the abstract objects â€¹xâ€º are defined algebraically using Bounded Natural Functor,
the implied operators including mapper, relator, predicator, etc. are also considered abstract.
The range is unfixed and may extended if reasonable.

When we say we lift the verification onto an abstract domain, precisely we mean the proof obligation
extracted by our reasoning is a boolean assertion consisting of only the abstract operators as above
plus boolean connectives and other basic primitives like projections of product type.
It basically means the reasoning is made by composition of the rules giving abstraction, and the
extracted proof obligation is a composition of the abstract operators given in the rules.
â€º


subsubsection â€¹Rulesâ€º

lemma Ï†Type_eqI_Tr:
  â€¹ (â‹€x. x â¦‚ T ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ x â¦‚ U)
âŸ¹ (â‹€x. x â¦‚ U ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ x â¦‚ T)
âŸ¹ T = Uâ€º
  unfolding Ï†Type_def Transformation_def
  by auto (meson BI_eq_iff ext)

lemma Ï†Type_eqI_BI:
  â€¹ (â‹€x. (x â¦‚ T) = (x â¦‚ U))
âŸ¹ T = U â€º
  unfolding Ï†Type_def fun_eq_iff
  by blast

lemma transformation_refl[simp]:
  "A ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ A" unfolding Transformation_def by fast

lemma transformation_trans:
  "A ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ B ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— P
âŸ¹ (P âŸ¹ B ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ C ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— Q)
âŸ¹ A ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ C ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— P âˆ§ Q"
  unfolding Transformation_def Premise_def by auto

lemma mk_intro_transformation:
  â€¹ A ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ B
âŸ¹ X ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ A ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— P
âŸ¹ X ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ B ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— P â€º
  unfolding Transformation_def
  by simp

lemma mk_elim_transformation:
  â€¹ A ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ B
âŸ¹ B ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ Y ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— P
âŸ¹ A ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ Y ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— P â€º
  unfolding Transformation_def
  by simp blast

lemma transformation_weaken:
  â€¹ P âŸ¶ P'
âŸ¹ A ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ B ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— P
âŸ¹ A ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ B ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— P'â€º
  unfolding Transformation_def by simp

lemma transformation_intro_inhab:
  â€¹ (ğ—‰ğ—‹ğ–¾ğ—†ğ—‚ğ—Œğ–¾ Satisfiable A âŸ¹ A ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ B ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— P)
âŸ¹ A ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ B ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— P â€º
  unfolding Transformation_def Satisfiable_def Satisfaction_def
  by blast

lemma assertion_eq_intro:
  â€¹ P ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ Q
âŸ¹ Q ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ P
âŸ¹ P = Qâ€º
  unfolding Transformation_def BI_eq_iff by blast

lemma BI_eq_ToA:
  â€¹ P = Q âŸ· (P ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ Q) âˆ§ (Q ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ P) â€º
  unfolding BI_eq_iff Transformation_def
  by blast

lemma BI_sub_transformation:
  â€¹ S â‰¤ S' âŸ· (S ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ S') â€º
  unfolding Transformation_def Satisfaction_def subset_iff
  by (simp add: less_eq_BI_def subset_iff)

lemma BI_sub_iff:
  â€¹ S â‰¤ S' âŸ· (âˆ€u. u âŠ¨ S âŸ¶ u âŠ¨ S') â€º
  unfolding Satisfaction_def subset_iff
  by (meson less_eq_BI_def subset_eq)

lemma transformation_protector:
  â€¹A ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ B ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— P â‰¡ A ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ B ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— Pâ€º .

subsubsection â€¹Forms of Reasoningâ€º

consts ğ’¯ğ’«  :: action â€• â€¹Transformation Problem, x : T --> f(x) : U, or between assertions, can be abductive
                         but never bi-abductive.â€º
       ğ’¯ğ’«' :: action â€• â€¹Bi-abductive Transformation Problem with Remainders and Demands, x : T * W --> f(x) : U * Râ€º
       ğ’œclean :: action

abbreviation ğ’œclean' :: â€¹bool â‡’ boolâ€º ("_/ @clean" [9] 9)
  where â€¹P @clean â‰¡ P @tag ğ’œcleanâ€º

text â€¹There are two kinds of transformation rule

â–ª cast-rule: â€¹x â¦‚ T ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ f(x) â¦‚ U ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— P(x)â€º binding on pattern â€¹x â¦‚ T ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ _ â¦‚ U ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— _â€º,
  which specifies how to transform a given Ï†-type â€¹x â¦‚ Tâ€º into the target type â€¹Uâ€º and what is the
  resulted abstract object with yielding any auxiliary pure facts â€¹P(x)â€º.

â–ª intro-rule: â€¹X ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ g(y) â¦‚ U' ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— P âŸ¹ X ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ y â¦‚ U ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— P âˆ§ Q(y)â€º binding on
  pattern â€¹_ ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ y â¦‚ U ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— _â€º, which specifies how to construct â€¹y â¦‚ Uâ€º by construction
  from â€¹g(y) â¦‚ U'â€º.
    
â–ª elim-rule: â€¹g(x) â¦‚ T' ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ Y ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— P âŸ¹ x â¦‚ T ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ Y ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— P âˆ§ Q(x)â€º binding on
  pattern â€¹x â¦‚ T ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ _ ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— _â€º, which specifies how to destruct â€¹x â¦‚ Tâ€º in sense of opening
  its encapsulated abstraction to then deduce whatever we want.

(*TODO: revise the text below!!!*)
Among the rules generated from â€¹Ï†type_defâ€º, only the cast-rules are registered and activated.
Case-rule is point to point (from a specific type to another specific) so it is safe.
The intro-rule and the elim-rule reduce the abstraction level.
They cause the reasoning reduces to a lower level of abstraction.
Users can always activate the rules at their discretion.

Intro-rule and elim-rule can always be applied manually. It doesn't burden the user even a little because
the rules are used only when opening and closing an abstraction, in the case that should only happens
when building an interface or an internal operation of a data structure, where users can
write the intro-rule and the elim-rule at the beginning and the end of the program without thinking a bit.
â€º

text â€¹In reasoning, the â€¹Pâ€º in any goal is always an OUT-argument.â€º


text â€¹Upon above, we present in addition two extension forms providing partial transformations
  where a part of the source object may transform to only a part of the target object, leaving some
  remainder of the source and some unsolved target part for later reasoning.

â–¸ â€¹x â¦‚ T ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ f(x) â¦‚ Uâ€º, the usual one-Ï†type-to-one-Ï†type transformation.
â–¸ â€¹x â¦‚ T âˆ—[False] âŠ¤â‡©Ï† ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ (f(x), r(x)) â¦‚ U âˆ—[Cr] Râ€º or alternatively
  â€¹x â¦‚ T ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ f(x) â¦‚ U ğ—‹ğ–¾ğ—†ğ–ºğ—‚ğ—‡ğ—Œ[Cr] R(x)â€º, the transformation with remainders
â–¸ â€¹x â¦‚ T âˆ—[Cw] W ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ (f(x), r(x)) â¦‚ U âˆ—[Cr] Râ€º, with both remainders and unsolved target parts.

where â€¹Cw, Crâ€º are boolean conditions deciding if the remainder and respectively the unsolved aims
are presented.
The forms constitute a lattice where the reasoning of the bottom reduce to the top.

Note â€¹x â¦‚ T ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ (f(x), r(x)) â¦‚ U âˆ—[Cr] Râ€º is not admissible though it is syntactically valid.
As it is entailed by the more general â€¹x â¦‚ T âˆ—[Cw] W ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ (f(x), r(x)) â¦‚ U âˆ—[Cr] Râ€º, and more
important, the pattern of â€¹x â¦‚ T ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ â€¦â€º also covers that of â€¹x â¦‚ T âˆ—[Cw] W ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ _â€º when â€¹Tâ€º
is variable, meaning inefficiency in selecting rule during reasoning, we dismiss â€¹x â¦‚ T ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ â€¦â€º
for the sake of reasoning performance and reducing the total number of reasoning rules.

In this way, designers of Ï†-types only require to provide two forms of rules,
â€¹x â¦‚ T ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ y â¦‚ Uâ€º and â€¹x â¦‚ T âˆ—[Cw] W ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ y â¦‚ U âˆ—[Cr] Râ€º
â€º

definition REMAINS :: â€¹ 'a::sep_magma_1 BI â‡’ 'a BI â‡’ 'a BI â€º ("_ ğ—‹ğ–¾ğ—†ğ–ºğ—‚ğ—‡ğ—Œ _" [14,14] 13)
  where â€¹(X ğ—‹ğ–¾ğ—†ğ–ºğ—‚ğ—‡ğ—Œ R) â‰¡ X * Râ€º
  â€• â€¹The â€¹Câ€º should be a variable sending to the later reasoning which decides if the transformation
      results in some remainders. Or, exceptionally, â€¹Câ€º can be constant â€¹Trueâ€º for unital algebras
      and the later reasoning sets the remainder to â€¹1â€º if it does not really results in remainders.

      It means, every reasoning procedure should prepare two versions, the one for variable â€¹Câ€º
      and another for the â€¹Câ€º of constant â€¹Trueâ€º.

      A reasoning procedure can at any time if on a unital algebra, set a variable â€¹Câ€º to â€¹Trueâ€º
      and turns the reasoning into the unital mode.â€º

definition Ï†Prod :: " ('concrete::sep_magma, 'abs_a) Ï† â‡’ ('concrete, 'abs_b) Ï† â‡’ ('concrete, 'abs_a Ã— 'abs_b) Ï†" (infixr "âˆ—" 70)
  where "A âˆ— B = (Î»(a,b). A a * B b)"

definition Ï†Prod' :: " ('concrete::sep_magma_1, 'abs_a) Ï† â‡’ ('concrete, 'abs_b) Ï† â‡’ ('concrete, 'abs_a Ã— 'abs_b) Ï†" (infixr "âœ¼" 67)
  where "Ï†Prod' = Ï†Prod"

lemma Ï†Prod_expn[Ï†expns, simp]:
  "concrete âŠ¨ (x â¦‚ A âˆ— B) âŸ· (âˆƒca cb. concrete = ca * cb âˆ§ cb âŠ¨ (snd x â¦‚ B) âˆ§ ca âŠ¨ (fst x â¦‚ A) âˆ§ ca ## cb)"
  unfolding Ï†Prod_def Ï†Type_def by (cases x; simp) blast

definition Ï†None :: â€¹('v::one, 'x) Ï†â€º ("â—‹") where â€¹â—‹ = (Î»x. 1)â€º


text â€¹In reasoning, the â€¹P,R,Wâ€º in any goal are always OUT-arguments.â€º

ML â€¹val phi_allow_source_object_to_be_not_variable =
          Config.declare_bool ("phi_allow_source_object_to_be_not_variable", âŒ‚) (K false)â€º

ML_file â€¹library/syntax/transformation.MLâ€º

declare [[
  (*a general checker warns if the abstract object of the source is not a variable*)
  Ï†reason_default_pattern_ML â€¹_ â¦‚ _ ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ _ ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— _â€º â‡’ â€¹fn ctxt =>
    fn tm as (Trueprop $ (Transformation $ (PhiTyp $ x $ _) $ _ $ _)) => (
      if not (is_Var (Term.head_of x)) andalso
         Context_Position.is_visible_generic ctxt andalso
         not (Config.get_generic ctxt phi_allow_source_object_to_be_not_variable)
      then warning (let open Pretty in string_of (chunks [
              para "The abstract object of the source of a transformation rule should be a variable.\n",
              Context.cases Syntax.pretty_term_global Syntax.pretty_term ctxt tm
            ]) end)
      else () ;
      NONE
  )â€º (1000),

  Ï†reason_default_pattern

      â€¹ERROR(TEXT(â€¹Malformed Ruleâ€º (?X ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ ?Y ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— ?P @tag ğ’¯ğ’«)))â€º (10)

                  â€¹Please indicate manuallyâ€º)â€º (10)

  and â€¹?var_x â¦‚ ?var_T ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ _ â¦‚ ?U @cleanâ€º â‡’ â€¹_ ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ _ â¦‚ ?U ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— _ @cleanâ€º (25)

  and â€¹?X ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ 1 @cleanâ€º â‡’ â€¹?X ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ _ ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— _ @cleanâ€º (100)

  and â€¹_ â¦‚ â—‹ ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ ?Y @cleanâ€º â‡’ â€¹_ ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ ?Y ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— _ @cleanâ€º (100)
]]

lemma REMAINS_expn[Ï†expns,simp]:
  â€¹ p âŠ¨ (A ğ—‹ğ–¾ğ—†ğ–ºğ—‚ğ—‡ğ—Œ R) âŸ· (p âŠ¨ A * R) â€º
  unfolding REMAINS_def
  by simp

subsubsection â€¹Allocation of Prioritiesâ€º

Ï†reasoner_group
  ToA_all         = (100, [0, 4999]) for â€¹_ ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ _ ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— _â€º
                    â€¹Rules of transformationâ€º
  ToA_bottom      = (0, [0, 15]) in ToA_all
                    â€¹System transformation rules, of the lowest priorityâ€º
  ToA             = (100, [16, 4999]) in ToA_all > ToA_bottom
                    â€¹User rules for transformationâ€º
  ToA_bk          = (100, [16, 999]) in ToA
                    â€¹Backtracking rulesâ€º
  ToA_cut         = (1000, [1000, 1399]) in ToA
                    â€¹Deterministic transformation rules without backtracking, meaning the reasoning
                     on the specified cases is definite and no branching.â€º
  NToA_tgt        = (1430, [1400, 1499]) > ToA_cut in ToA
                    â€¹â€º
  ToA_splitting     = (1550, [1500,1599]) > ToA_cut in ToA
                    â€¹Transformation rules splitting the reasoning goal into more subgoalsâ€º
  ToA_splitting_target = (1600, [1600,1601]) > ToA_splitting in ToA
                    â€¹split the separation sequent in the target part and reason the tranformation for
                     each separated item one by one.â€º
  ToA_assertion_cut = (1700, [1700,1899]) > ToA_splitting in ToA
                    â€¹Deterministic transformation rules between unsplitted assertions.â€º
  ToA_normalizing = (2000, [1950, 2299]) > ToA_assertion_cut in ToA
                    â€¹Rules normalizing the transformation problem. A normalization rule should neither
                     branch nor yield new subgoal, i.e., always from onetransformation to another
                     transformaiton. If it branches, see %ToA_branches; if yields new assertions,
                     see %ToA_assertion_cutâ€º
  ToA_fixes_quant = (2500, [2500, 2590]) > NToA_tgt in ToA
                    â€¹Transformation rules fixing quantified variables.â€º
  ToA_red         = (2600, [2600, 2649]) > ToA_fixes_quant in ToA
                    â€¹Transformation rules reducing literal or trivial cases.â€º
  ToA_success     = (3000, [2960, 3499])
                    â€¹Transformation rules that are shortcuts leading to success on special casesâ€º
  ToA_systop      = (4900, [4900, 4999]) in ToA
                    â€¹System rules of the highest priorityâ€º
  ToA_assigning_var = (4100, [4100, 4110]) in ToA and < ToA_systop
                    â€¹Tranformation rules assigning variable targets or sources, of the highest priority
                     as occurrences of schematic variables are usually not considered in the subsequent
                     normal process of the reasoning, and may cause unexpected exception in them.â€º
  ToA_refl        = (4000, [3990, 4019]) in ToA and < ToA_assigning_var and > ToA_success
                    â€¹Reflexive tranformation rulesâ€º
  ToA_splitting_source = (50, [50,50]) for â€¹_ * _ ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ _ ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— _â€º < ToA_cut in ToA
                    â€¹split the separation sequent in the source part and reason the tranformation for
                     each separated item one by one.â€º
  ToA_elim_intro  = (19, [19,19]) in ToA < default
                    â€¹Elimination and introduction rules that unfold Ï†-typesâ€º
  ToA_weak        = (20, [20,24]) in ToA < default and > ToA_elim_intro
                    â€¹Weak transformation rules giving some reasoning support temporarily and expecting to be orverrideâ€º
  ToA_derived     = (50, [25,79]) in ToA < default and > ToA_weak
                    â€¹Automatically derived transformations. Many substructures are contained in this large range.â€º
  ToA_derived_red = (150, [130,170]) for â€¹_ * _ ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ _ ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— _â€º > ToA_derived > default in ToA
                    â€¹Automatically derived transformation reductions.â€º
  ToA_weak_red    = (120, [120,129]) for â€¹_ * _ ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ _ ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— _â€º < ToA_derived_red in ToA
                    â€¹Weak reduction rules giving some reasoning support temporarily and expecting to be orverrideâ€º
  ToA_user        = (100, [80,119]) in ToA and < ToA_weak_red and > ToA_derived
                    â€¹default group for user rulesâ€º

declare [[
  Ï†default_reasoner_group â€¹_ ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ _ ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— _ @tag ğ’¯ğ’«â€º : %ToA_user (10)
                      and â€¹?var ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ _ â¦‚ _ ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— _ @tag ğ’¯ğ’«â€º : %ToA_elim_intro (100)
                      and â€¹_ â¦‚ _ ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ ?var ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— _ @tag ğ’¯ğ’«â€º : %ToA_elim_intro (100)
]]

Ï†reasoner_group ToA_clean_all = (100, [10,3000]) for â€¹_ ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ _ ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— _ @cleanâ€º
      â€¹All transformation cleaning wastes and debrisâ€º
  and ToA_clean = (1020, [1000,1050]) in ToA_clean_all â€¹â€º
  and ToA_clean_fallback = (20,[10,30]) in ToA_clean_all < ToA_clean â€¹â€º

declare [[
  Ï†default_reasoner_group â€¹_ ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ _ ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— _ @cleanâ€º : %ToA_clean (20)
]]

paragraph â€¹Bottom Groupsâ€º

Ï†reasoner_group
  ToA_falling_latice = (1, [0,4]) for â€¹_ ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ _ ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— _â€º in ToA_bottom
                    â€¹Fallbacks of transformation rulesâ€º
  ToA_unified_refl = (5, [5,6]) for â€¹_ ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ _ ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— _â€º in ToA_bottom and > ToA_falling_latice
                     â€¹Reflexive tranformation rules with unification, of a low priority because
                      unification is aggresive.â€º
  ToA_derv_unify_refl = (7, [7,8]) for â€¹_ ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ _ ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— _â€º in ToA_bottom and > ToA_unified_refl
                     â€¹derived ToA_unified_refl that override the default behaviors.â€º
  ToA_varify_target_object = (9, [9,9]) for â€¹_ ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ _ ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— _â€º in ToA_bottom and > ToA_derv_unify_refl
                    â€¹Varifies the fixed target object, using Object_Equivâ€º
  ToA_inst_qunat  = (10, [10,10]) for â€¹_ ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ _ ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— _â€º in ToA_bottom and > ToA_varify_target_object
                    â€¹Transformation rules instantiating quantified variables. It is unsafe unless
                     all fixable variables are fixed. If any variable is fixed later than the instantiation,
                     the instantiated schematic variable cannot caputure the later fixed variable.â€º
  ToA_branches    = (12, [11,15]) for â€¹_ ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ _ ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— _â€º in ToA_bottom and > ToA_inst_qunat
                    â€¹Branching transformation rules.â€º


paragraph â€¹Fallbackâ€º

text â€¹There are two trivial solutions for such problem.

  On commutative algebra, a transformation can do nothing but simply return the source to the remainder
  and demand subsequent transformation to the target. Such transformation is of the lowest priority
  serving as a fallback of the ordinary reasoning.

  â€¹ x â¦‚ T âˆ—[True] U ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ (snd x, fst x) â¦‚ U âˆ—[True] T â€º

  Another trivial solution is on unital algebras, where a transformation can assign the target object
  to the identity element of the type so the source term directly go to the remainder.

  â€¹ x â¦‚ T âˆ—[False] âŠ¤â‡©Ï† ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ (one, fst x) â¦‚ U âˆ—[True] T â€º where â€¹one â¦‚ U â‰¡ empâ€º

  This is the fallback rule for unital algebras that are non-commutative, and in this case when
  all transformations from T to U fail, assigning â€¹Uâ€º to identity element is the only available search
  branch so the fallback is safe. For commutative algebra, the previous fallback is applied.
  When â€¹Uâ€º is kept swapping and all source terms are passed, the still remaining â€¹Uâ€º is assigned
  with the identity element, so the case of â€¹one â¦‚ U â‰¡ empâ€º is still covered.



(*Implementation note:

  By default, such rule is not activated as it really does nothing, and clients have a way
  to know if the reasoning fails. However, if such fallback is expected, one can use reasoning goal
  â€¹ Try Cs (x â¦‚ T âˆ—[Cw] W ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ y â¦‚ U âˆ—[Cr] R) â€º
  in which boolean condition â€¹Csâ€º returns whether the reasoning really ever made some changes.*)
 â€º


text â€¹Rules are given in Â§â€¹Reasoning/Basic Transformation Rules/Fallbackâ€ºâ€º


subsubsection â€¹Extracting Pure Facts Implies Insideâ€º

lemma [Ï†reason %extract_pure]:
  â€¹ ğ—‹EIF A P
âŸ¹ ğ—‹EIF (A @tag ğ’¯ğ’«) P â€º
  unfolding Action_Tag_def .

lemma [Ï†reason %extract_pure]:
  â€¹ ğ—‹EIF A P
âŸ¹ ğ—‹EIF (A @tag ğ’¯ğ’«') P â€º
  unfolding Action_Tag_def .

lemma [Ï†reason %extract_pure]:
  â€¹ ğ—‹ESC P A
âŸ¹ ğ—‹ESC P (A @tag ğ’¯ğ’«) â€º
  unfolding Action_Tag_def .

lemma [Ï†reason %extract_pure]:
  â€¹ ğ—‹ESC P A
âŸ¹ ğ—‹ESC P (A @tag ğ’¯ğ’«') â€º
  unfolding Action_Tag_def .

text â€¹This is used in Ï†-derivers, particularly in induction whenâ€º

lemma [Ï†reason %extract_pure]:
  â€¹ Pâ‡©A ğ—Œğ—ğ–¿ğ–¿ğ—‚ğ–¼ğ–¾ğ—Œ A
âŸ¹ B ğ—‚ğ—†ğ—‰ğ—…ğ—‚ğ–¾ğ—Œ Pâ‡©B
âŸ¹ ğ—‹EIF (A ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ B ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— P) (Pâ‡©A âŸ¶ Pâ‡©B âˆ§ P) â€º
  unfolding Action_Tag_def ğ—‹EIF_def ğ—‹ESC_def Satisfiable_def Transformation_def
  by clarsimp

ML â€¹
fun extracting_elim_or_intro_ToA is_intro ctxt sequent =
  let val target = case HOLogic.dest_Trueprop (Thm.major_prem_of sequent)
                     of Const(\<^const_name>â€¹ğ—‹EIFâ€º, _) $ target $ _ => target
                      | _ => raise THM ("extracting_elim_or_intro_ToA", 1, [sequent])
      fun get_concl (Const(\<^const_name>â€¹HOL.impliesâ€º, _) $ _ $ X) = get_concl X
        | get_concl X = X
      val concl = get_concl target
      fun get_V (A, B) = if is_intro then A else B
      val (A, B, Var p) = Phi_Syntax.dest_transformation (fst (HOLogic.dest_imp target))
      val Var v = get_V (A, B)

      fun parse_P (Var p) = p 
        | parse_P (Const(\<^const_name>â€¹HOL.conjâ€º, _) $ Var p $ _) = p

   in case try Phi_Syntax.dest_transformation concl
   of SOME (A', B', P') => if get_V (A', B') = Var v andalso p = parse_P P'
      then SOME ((ctxt, @{lemma' â€¹ ğ—‹EIF S C
                              âŸ¹ ğ—‹EIF ((A ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ A) âŸ¶ S) C â€º
                             by simp}
                          RS sequent), Seq.empty)
      else NONE
  end
â€º

Ï†reasoner_ML Transformationâ‡©I_ğ’œEIF' %extract_pure+10 (â€¹ğ—‹EIF ((?var ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ _ ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— ?var_P) âŸ¶ _) _ â€º) = â€¹
  fn (_, (ctxt, sequent)) => Seq.make (fn () => extracting_elim_or_intro_ToA true ctxt sequent)
â€º

Ï†reasoner_ML Transformationâ‡©E_ğ’œEIF' %extract_pure+10 (â€¹ğ—‹EIF ((_ ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ ?var ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— ?var_P) âŸ¶ _) _ â€º) = â€¹
  fn (_, (ctxt, sequent)) => Seq.make (fn () => extracting_elim_or_intro_ToA false ctxt sequent)
â€º

lemma ToA_EIF_sat:
  â€¹ (â‹€v. ğ—Œğ—‚ğ—†ğ—‰ğ—…ğ—‚ğ–¿ğ—’ vA v : v âŠ¨ A)
âŸ¹ (â‹€v. ğ—Œğ—‚ğ—†ğ—‰ğ—…ğ—‚ğ–¿ğ—’ vB v : v âŠ¨ B)
âŸ¹ ğ—‹EIF (A ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ B ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— P) (âˆ€v. vA v âŸ¶ vB v âˆ§ P) â€º
  unfolding ğ—‹EIF_def Satisfiable_def Transformation_def Simplify_def
  by clarsimp

lemma ToA_ESC_sat:
  â€¹ (â‹€v. ğ—Œğ—‚ğ—†ğ—‰ğ—…ğ—‚ğ–¿ğ—’ vA v : v âŠ¨ A)
âŸ¹ (â‹€v. ğ—Œğ—‚ğ—†ğ—‰ğ—…ğ—‚ğ–¿ğ—’ vB v : v âŠ¨ B)
âŸ¹ ğ—‹ESC (âˆ€v. vA v âŸ¶ vB v âˆ§ P) (A ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ B ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— P) â€º
  unfolding ğ—‹ESC_def Satisfiable_def Transformation_def Simplify_def
  by clarsimp

bundle ToA_extract_pure_sat = ToA_EIF_sat[Ï†reason %extract_pure_sat]
                              ToA_ESC_sat[Ï†reason %extract_pure_sat]

paragraph â€¹Auxiliary Toolsâ€º

definition May_Assign :: â€¹'a â‡’ 'a â‡’ boolâ€º
  where â€¹May_Assign _ _ â‰¡ Trueâ€º

Ï†reasoner_group may_assign__all = (100, [1,2000]) for â€¹May_Assign var valâ€º â€¹â€º

  and may_assign_fallback = (1, [1,1]) in may_assign__all â€¹â€º

  â€¹ May_Assign z z â€º
  unfolding May_Assign_def ..

  â€¹May_Assign x y â€º

âŸ¹ May_Assign (snd (x,y)) z â€º

subsection â€¹Topâ€º

notation top ("âŠ¤")

subsubsection â€¹Rewritesâ€º

  â€¹Satisfiable âŠ¤ âŸ· Trueâ€º
  unfolding Satisfiable_def
  by clarsimp

subsubsection â€¹Transformation Rulesâ€º

Ï†reasoner_group ToA_top = (%ToA_success, [%ToA_success-1, %ToA_success+1]) for â€¹_ ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ âŠ¤ ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— _â€º
                          â€¹Transformation rules handling âŠ¤â€º

text â€¹The target part is assumed having no schematic variable, so it is safe to do such shortcuts
      comparing with the bottom-in-source.â€º

(*TODO!*)

declare [[Ï†trace_reasoning = 1]]

lemma [Ï†reason %ToA_top]:
  â€¹Any ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ âŠ¤â€º
  unfolding Transformation_def by blast

lemma [Ï†reason %ToA_top]:
  â€¹Any ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ âŠ¤ ğ—‹ğ–¾ğ—†ğ–ºğ—‚ğ—‡ğ—Œ 1â€º
  unfolding Transformation_def
  by simp

lemma [Ï†reason %ToA_top]:
  â€¹ A ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ âŠ¤ * B
âŸ¹ A ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ âŠ¤ * B ğ—‹ğ–¾ğ—†ğ–ºğ—‚ğ—‡ğ—Œ 1â€º
  unfolding Transformation_def
  by simp

(*The following procedure only supports commutative semigroup*)
 
lemma [Ï†reason %ToA_top+1 if â€¹fn (ctxt,sequent) =>
          case Phi_Syntax.dest_transformation (Thm.major_prem_of sequent)
            of (_, (_ (*times*) $ _ $ R), _)
               => let fun chk (Const(\<^const_name>â€¹timesâ€º, _) $ X $ Const(\<^const_name>â€¹topâ€º, _)) = chk X
                        | chk (Const(\<^const_name>â€¹topâ€º, _)) = false
                        | chk _ = true
                   in chk R
                  endâ€º]:
  â€¹ Any ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ R * âŠ¤ ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— P
âŸ¹ Any ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ âŠ¤ * R ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— Pâ€º
  for Any :: â€¹'a::sep_ab_semigroup BIâ€º
  by (simp add: mult.commute)

(*when we reach here, it means R all consists of âŠ¤, so that we can eliminate them one-by-one,
  until the last one which can be done by â€¹Any ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ âŠ¤â€º directly.
  Again we assume and only consider commutative semigroup*)

lemma [Ï†reason %ToA_top]:
  â€¹ A ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ R ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— P
âŸ¹ A * B ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ âŠ¤ * R ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— Pâ€º
  for A :: â€¹'a::sep_ab_semigroup BIâ€º
  unfolding Transformation_def
  by (clarsimp, insert sep_disj_commuteI sep_mult_commute, blast)

lemma [Ï†reason %ToA_top-1]:
  â€¹ A ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ R ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— P
âŸ¹ A ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ âŠ¤ * R ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— Pâ€º
  for A :: â€¹'a::sep_algebra BIâ€º
  unfolding Transformation_def
  by clarsimp (metis mult_1_class.mult_1_left sep_magma_1_right)

lemma [Ï†reason %fail]:
  â€¹ FAIL TEXT(â€¹Sorry, currently we do not support solving â€¹âŠ¤ * Râ€º problems on non-monoidal and non-commutative group.â€º)
âŸ¹ X ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ âŠ¤ * R ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— Pâ€º
  unfolding Transformation_def FAIL_def
  by blast



subsection â€¹Bottomâ€º

text â€¹Despite of semantically â€¹0 = âŠ¥â€º where syntactically â€¹âŠ¥ â‰¡ {}â€º, but there is not syntactically
  â€¹0 â‰¡ {}â€º. We prefer to use â€¹0â€º instead of the more usual â€¹âŠ¥â€º for the sake of forming
  a semiring together with â€¹1 â‰¡ empâ€º, â€¹*â€º, â€¹+ â‰¡ âˆ¨â‡©Bâ‡©Iâ€º, to leverage the existing automation of semiring.â€º

abbreviation Bottom ("âŠ¥â‡©Bâ‡©I") where â€¹Bottom â‰¡ (0::'a::sep_magma BI)â€º
abbreviation Bottom_abs ("âŠ¥â‡©Î»") where â€¹Bottom_abs â‰¡ (0 :: 'b â‡’ 'a::sep_magma BI)â€º

lemma bot_eq_BI_bot [Ï†programming_base_simps, Ï†programming_simps]:
  â€¹bot = âŠ¥â‡©Bâ‡©Iâ€º
  unfolding zero_BI_def bot_BI_def ..

lemma zero_implies_any[simp]:
  â€¹0 ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ X ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— Anyâ€º
  unfolding Transformation_def zero_set_def Satisfaction_def
  by (cases X; simp add: zero_BI_def)

subsubsection â€¹Rewritesâ€º

lemma Bot_Satisfiable[simp]:
  â€¹ Satisfiable 0 âŸ· False â€º
  unfolding Satisfiable_def
  by clarsimp

subsubsection â€¹Transformation Rulesâ€º

Ï†reasoner_group ToA_bot = (%ToA_cut+5, [%ToA_cut, %ToA_cut+10]) for â€¹0 ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ _ ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— _â€º
   â€¹Transformation rules when the source assertion is 0.
    The rule is not of a highest priority because the target may contain schematic variables,
    and the usual reasoning procedure is still required to unfold the target connective-by-connective
    to ensure every variables inside is instantiated.â€º

lemma [Ï†reason %ToA_cut for â€¹0 ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ _ ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— _ @tag ğ’¯ğ’«â€º
                            â€¹?var ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ _ ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— _ @tag ğ’¯ğ’«â€º]:
  â€¹0 ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ X ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— False @tag ğ’¯ğ’«â€º
  unfolding Action_Tag_def
  by simp


lemma [Ï†reason %ToA_bot for â€¹0 ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ _ ğ—‹ğ–¾ğ—†ğ–ºğ—‚ğ—‡ğ—Œ _ ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— _ @tag ğ’¯ğ’«â€º
                            â€¹?var ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ _ ğ—‹ğ–¾ğ—†ğ–ºğ—‚ğ—‡ğ—Œ _ ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— _ @tag ğ’¯ğ’«â€º ]:
  â€¹0 ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ X ğ—‹ğ–¾ğ—†ğ–ºğ—‚ğ—‡ğ—Œ 0 ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— False @tag ğ’¯ğ’«â€º
  using zero_implies_any Transformation_def Action_Tag_def
  by simp


paragraph â€¹Reductionsâ€º

lemma [Ï†reason %ToA_red for â€¹0 * _ ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ _ ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— _ @tag ğ’¯ğ’«â€º
                            â€¹?var * _ ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ _ ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— _ @tag ğ’¯ğ’«â€º ]:

subsection â€¹Unitâ€º

lemma Ï†None_expn[Ï†expns, simp]:
  â€¹p âŠ¨ (x â¦‚ Ï†None) âŸ· p = 1â€º
  unfolding Ï†None_def Ï†Type_def
  by simp

lemma Ï†None_inhabited[elim!]:
  â€¹Satisfiable (x â¦‚ Ï†None) âŸ¹ C âŸ¹ Câ€º .

lemma Prod_Ï†None_red:
  â€¹ x â¦‚ T âˆ— â—‹ â‰¡ fst x â¦‚ Tâ€º
  â€¹ y â¦‚ â—‹ âˆ— T â‰¡ snd y â¦‚ Tâ€º
  â€¹ x' â¦‚ â—‹ âˆ— (â—‹ :: ('v::sep_magma_1, 'x) Ï†) â‰¡ 1â€º
  for T :: â€¹('a::sep_magma_1, 'b) Ï†â€º
  unfolding atomize_eq BI_eq_iff
  by ((rule Ï†Type_eqI)?; clarsimp)+

subsubsection â€¹Propertiesâ€º

lemma [Ï†reason %extract_pure]:
  â€¹1 ğ—‚ğ—†ğ—‰ğ—…ğ—‚ğ–¾ğ—Œ Trueâ€º
  unfolding ğ—‹EIF_def
  by blast

lemma [Ï†reason %extract_pure]:
  â€¹ True ğ—Œğ—ğ–¿ğ–¿ğ—‚ğ–¼ğ–¾ğ—Œ 1 â€º
  unfolding ğ—‹ESC_def Satisfiable_def
  by simp

lemma Emp_Satisfiable[simp]:
  â€¹ Satisfiable 1 âŸ· True â€º
  unfolding Satisfiable_def
  by clarsimp

subsubsection â€¹Transformation Rulesâ€º

lemma [Ï†reason %ToA_success]:
  â€¹X ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ 1 ğ—‹ğ–¾ğ—†ğ–ºğ—‚ğ—‡ğ—Œ Xâ€º
  for X :: â€¹'a::sep_magma_1 BIâ€º
  unfolding REMAINS_def Action_Tag_def by simp

lemma [Ï†reason %ToA_red]:
  " H ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ X ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— P
âŸ¹ H ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ 1 * X ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— P "
  for X :: â€¹'a::sep_magma_1 BIâ€º
  unfolding mult_1_left .

lemma [Ï†reason %ToA_red]:
  " H ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ X ğ—‹ğ–¾ğ—†ğ–ºğ—‚ğ—‡ğ—Œ R ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— P
âŸ¹ H ğ—ğ—‹ğ–ºğ—‡ğ—Œğ–¿ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—†ğ—Œ 1 * X ğ—‹ğ–¾ğ—†ğ–ºğ—‚ğ—‡ğ—Œ R ğ—ğ—‚ğ—ğ— P"

  unfolding mult_1_left .
